de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder

Class AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<DialogType extends ButtonBarDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractMaterialDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractHeaderDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractAnimateableDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractValidateableDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
              • de.mrapp.android.dialog.builder.AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DialogType - The type of the dialog, which is created by the builder
    BuilderType - The type of the builder
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractListDialogBuilder, ProgressDialog.Builder

    public abstract class AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<DialogType extends ButtonBarDialog,BuilderType extends AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder<DialogType,?>>
extends AbstractValidateableDialogBuilder<DialogType,BuilderType>
    An abstract base class for all builders, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
    Since:
    3.3.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder(android.content.Context context)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
      AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder(android.content.Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder

        public AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder

        public AbstractButtonBarDialogBuilder(@NonNull
                                      android.content.Context context,
                                      @StyleRes
                                      int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which allow to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and may contain up to three buttons.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • stackButtons

        public final BuilderType stackButtons(boolean stackButtons)
        Sets, whether the buttons of the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be aligned vertically, or not.
        Parameters:
        stackButtons - True, if the buttons of the dialog, which is created by the builder, should be aligned vertically, false otherwise
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setNegativeButton

        public final BuilderType setNegativeButton(@Nullable
                                           java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                           @Nullable
                                           android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the text of the negative button of the dialog, which is created by the builder. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        text - The text, which should be set, as an instance of the type CharSequence or null, if no negative button should be shown
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the negative button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType

      • setNegativeButton

        public final BuilderType setNegativeButton(@StringRes
                                           int resourceId,
                                           @Nullable
                                           android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the text of the negative button of the dialog, which is created by the builder. Note, that the attached listener is not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listener.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the text, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid string resource
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when the negative button is clicked, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the generic type BuilderType
